definition: he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another

sentences.english: Whowould want a warmonger that is always tries to invade other countries in his or her own back yard anyways?
sentences.chinese: 是誰總是在他國後院想方設法搞破壞呢？

sentences.english: Students must respect the habits and customs of China and other countries.
sentences.chinese: 尊重中國人民和他國人民的文化傳統和風俗習慣。

sentences.english: Amercia intends to get military supremacy over other nations.
sentences.chinese: 美國企圖獲得對他國的軍事控制權。

sentences.english: Deuteronomy 18:9 commands Israelites not to copy the toevah of other nations.
sentences.chinese: 申命記18:09命令以色列人不要模仿他國的禮教。

sentences.english: There are people out there, this is the first step to invade other country thatthey're concerning.
sentences.chinese: 他們派人到戰場上，首先侵略與自己有關的他國。

sentences.english: No sooner had the spy returned home than he was told to go to another country.
sentences.chinese: 那個諜報員剛踏進國門就被受命要去他國。

definition: to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to end a relationship/to break off diplomatic ties
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
